title: Avoiding Groupthink
content: Groupthink occurs when desire for harmony overrides realistic evaluation of alternatives. Signs include: suppressed dissent, illusion of unanimity, pressure on dissenters, and self-censorship. Fight groupthink by actively seeking criticism, assigning devil's advocate roles, and breaking into subgroups for independent analysis.

mcq.question: Your team seems to quickly agree on a solution without much discussion. Everyone nods. What should you consider?

options.B: Possible groupthink—test by asking for concerns and alternatives

mcq.explanation: Quick agreement without debate is a groupthink warning sign. Test it: explicitly ask for concerns, ask what could go wrong, assign someone to argue against. Real agreement survives challenge.

openQuestions: What techniques do you use to prevent groupthink?
